member.name: P:Avalonia.AvaloniaNativePlatformOptions.OverlayPopups

member.summary: This property should be used in case you want to build Avalonia OSX native part by yourself and make your Avalonia app run with it. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Avalonia.AvaloniaNativePlatformOptions.AppSandboxEnabled
member.summary: If you distribute your app in App Store - it should be with sandbox enabled. This parameter enables and related APIs, as well as wrapping all storage related calls in secure context. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Avalonia.MacOSPlatformOptions.ShowInDock
member.summary: Determines whether to show your application in the dock when it runs. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Avalonia.MacOSPlatformOptions.DisableDefaultApplicationMenuItems
member.summary: By default, Avalonia adds items like Quit, Hide to the OSX Application Menu. You can prevent Avalonia from adding those items to the OSX Application Menu with this property. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Avalonia.MacOSPlatformOptions.DisableNativeMenus
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the native macOS menu bar will be enabled for the application.

member.name: P:Avalonia.MacOSPlatformOptions.DisableSetProcessName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the native macOS should set [NSProcessInfo setProcessName] in runtime.

member.name: P:Avalonia.MacOSPlatformOptions.DisableAvaloniaAppDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Avalonia can install its own AppDelegate. Disabling this can be useful in some scenarios like when running as a plugin inside an existing macOS application.
